title: Sion's Q does not do the damage it should
body:
When you fully charge Sion's Q, it doesn't seem to do the damage it should. I thought I'd build the damage to clear minion waves in 1 q. It said that at max charge, it would do 300 + 395 damage. This, according to my calculation, would be 695 damage without any extra's and such. 
Ranged minions had 500 hp, 0 armor, 0 magic resistance. Yet, my fully charged Decimating Smash did only 407 damage. 

Now, I realise that his Q only does 80% damage on minions. However, 695 * 0.8 = 556. The minions still should have died.

I'm not being extremely stupid somehow, am I?

replies.body: Unfortunately this is a tooltip bug. I'll double check next week and make sure that the intended numbers are working but my hunch is that 60% is the real number that he is balanced around.

Why is it .6? 

I feel that keeping a fully time-expending charged Sion Q should be able to decimate Caster Minions.
My guess is that it would give sion too much splitpushing power, and also allow him to stack his w passive too quickly.
Pretty much, we wanted the reward for hitting champs with a fully charged Q to be insane, but those poor minion waves don't ever dodge it. We're aiming for good waveclear, not best in game levels.

Is the in-game tooltip saying that Decimating Smash deals 80% damage to minions?

The good news is that Decimating Smash actually deals 60% reduced damage to minions.

The bad news is that Decimating Smash might actually still be bugged. 695 * .6 = 417, so you are still getting cheated out of some damage.

The tooltip does say 80% damage, and it is supposed to be 80%, not 60%, which we know because of the last time Q got a  nerf, the damage it dealt to minions and monsters was reduced from **90%** to **80%**.

It was never reduced to 60% at any point since the relaunch, and should never be dealing only 60% damage under any circumstances.

Check Sion's champion page on the website: http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/champions/sion/

"Sion charges up a heavy blow for up to 2 seconds. When released, he deals 20/40/60/80/100 (+60% Attack Damage) to 60/120/180/240/300 (+180% Attack Damage) physical damage to enemies in the area (60% damage to minions). Enemies hit are briefly slowed.If Sion charges for at least 1 second, enemies are knocked up and stunned for 1.25 to 2.25 seconds."

It's weird because it's never been patched to only deal 60% damage to minions as opposed to 80%, but at the same time that is how it seems to be working in-game.

That is a huge goof on Riot's part then, because the patch notes here: [Patch 5.6 notes | League of Legends](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-56-notes) say otherwise, and it has never been supposed to say 60% or deal 60%.
